snippet: Anatoly Karpov, 61, who was the world champion from the mid-1970s until the early 1980s, showed he could still compete with the best by winning the Anatoly Karpov Trophy in St. Petersburg, Russia.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column; Anatoly Karpov, 61, who was the world champion from the mid-1970s until the early 1980s, shows he can still compete with the best by winning the Anatoly Karpov Trophy in St Petersburg, Russia.
lead_paragraph: Anatoly Karpov, 61, who was the world champion from the mid-1970s until the early 1980s, showed he could still compete with the best by winning the Anatoly Karpov Trophy in St. Petersburg, Russia.

headline.print_headline: Former World Champion Wins Namesake Event
headline.seo: Chess: Karpov Wins the Karpov Trophy
headline.main: Former World Champion Wins Namesake Event
